snippet: In its decision, the World Health Organization highlighted the seriousness of the Zika outbreak, a mosquito-borne virus thought to cause birth defects that has exploded in Latin America, and gave countries powerful tools to fight it.
abstract: World Health Organization cites international public health emergency over rapidly-spreading Zika virus and its suspected link to birth defects; outbreak, transmitted by mosquitoes, began in Brazil in May 2015 and has spread to over 20 countries in Latin America.

byline.original: By SABRINA TAVERNISE and DONALD G. McNEIL Jr

lead_paragraph: In its decision, the World Health Organization highlighted the seriousness of the Zika outbreak, a mosquito-borne virus thought to cause birth defects that has exploded in Latin America, and gave countries powerful tools to fight it.

headline.main: Zika Virus a Global Health Emergency, W.H.O. Says
headline.print_headline: W.H.O. Cites Health Emergency Over Fast-Spreading Zika Virus
